title: ISSS608-VAA

About this site

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
Install and load required packages:

pacman::p_load(tidyverse, RColorBrewer)

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
Install and load required packages:

pacman::p_load(tidyverse, RColorBrewer)

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
Import the data
We read the CSV file containing exam data. Make sure the file is located in the data/ folder.

exam_data <- read_csv("data/Exam_data.csv")

Rows: 322 Columns: 7-- Column specification --------------------------------------------------------
Delimiter: ","
chr (4): ID, CLASS, GENDER, RACE
dbl (3): ENGLISH, MATHS, SCIENCE
i Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
i Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.

head(exam_data)

# A tibble: 6 x 7
  ID         CLASS GENDER RACE    ENGLISH MATHS SCIENCE
  <chr>      <chr> <chr>  <chr>     <dbl> <dbl>   <dbl>
1 Student321 3I    Male   Malay        21     9      15
2 Student305 3I    Female Malay        24    22      16
3 Student289 3H    Male   Chinese      26    16      16
4 Student227 3F    Male   Chinese      27    77      31
5 Student318 3I    Male   Malay        27    11      25
6 Student306 3I    Female Malay        31    16      16

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
Plotting a simple bar chart
Distribution of the RACE variable:

ggplot(data = exam_data, aes(x = RACE)) +
  geom_bar(fill = "steelblue") +
  theme_minimal() +
  labs(title = "Number of Students by Race",
       x = "Race",
       y = "Count")

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
Additional Plots

Histogram of English Scores

ggplot(exam_data, aes(x = ENGLISH)) +
  geom_histogram(bins = 20, fill = "forestgreen", color = "white") +
  theme_minimal() +
  labs(title = "Distribution of English Scores",
       x = "English Score",
       y = "Frequency")










Scatterplot: Maths vs Science

ggplot(exam_data, aes(x = MATHS, y = SCIENCE, color = GENDER)) +
  geom_point(alpha = 0.7, size = 2) +
  theme_minimal() +
  labs(title = "Maths vs Science Scores by Gender",
       x = "Maths Score",
       y = "Science Score")

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
Summary

Boxplot shows variation in maths scores across racial groups.
Density plot highlights the distribution shape of science performance.

© 2025 Hao Liu

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
Import Data

exam_data <- read_csv("data/Exam_data.csv")

Rows: 322 Columns: 7-- Column specification --------------------------------------------------------
Delimiter: ","
chr (4): ID, CLASS, GENDER, RACE
dbl (3): ENGLISH, MATHS, SCIENCE
i Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
i Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.

head(exam_data)

# A tibble: 6 x 7
  ID         CLASS GENDER RACE    ENGLISH MATHS SCIENCE
  <chr>      <chr> <chr>  <chr>     <dbl> <dbl>   <dbl>
1 Student321 3I    Male   Malay        21     9      15
2 Student305 3I    Female Malay        24    22      16
3 Student289 3H    Male   Chinese      26    16      16
4 Student227 3F    Male   Chinese      27    77      31
5 Student318 3I    Male   Malay        27    11      25
6 Student306 3I    Female Malay        31    16      16

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
Visualizations
Below are all the key plots for the exam dataset, each wrapped in a styled card and arranged responsively.



Bar Chart: Students by Race

ggplot(exam_data, aes(x = RACE)) +
  geom_bar(fill = "steelblue") +
  theme_minimal(base_size = 14) +
  labs(title = "Students by Race", x = NULL, y = "Count") +
  theme(panel.grid.minor = element_blank())











Score Distributions by Subject

# Reshape to long format for faceted histograms
exam_long <- exam_data %>%
  pivot_longer(cols = c(ENGLISH, MATHS, SCIENCE), names_to = "Subject", values_to = "Score")

ggplot(exam_long, aes(x = Score, fill = Subject)) +
  geom_histogram(bins = 20, color = "white", alpha = 0.7) +
  facet_wrap(~ Subject, scales = "free") +
  theme_minimal(base_size = 14) +
  labs(title = "Score Distributions by Subject", x = "Score", y = "Frequency") +
  theme(legend.position = "none", panel.grid.minor = element_blank())














Scatterplot: Maths vs Science by Gender

ggplot(exam_data, aes(x = MATHS, y = SCIENCE, color = GENDER)) +
  geom_point(alpha = 0.8, size = 2) +
  geom_smooth(method = "lm", se = TRUE, linetype = "dashed") +
  scale_color_brewer(palette = "Set1") +
  theme_minimal(base_size = 14) +
  labs(
    title = "Maths vs Science Scores by Gender",
    subtitle = "Scatterplot with linear trend lines",
    x = "Maths Score",
    y = "Science Score"
  ) +
  theme(legend.position = "bottom", panel.grid.minor = element_blank())

`geom_smooth()` using formula 'y ~ x'












Boxplot: Maths Scores by Race

ggplot(exam_data, aes(x = RACE, y = MATHS, fill = RACE)) +
  geom_boxplot(outlier.shape = NA, alpha = 0.6) +
  geom_jitter(width = 0.2, alpha = 0.5, size = 1) +
  scale_fill_brewer(palette = "Pastel2") +
  theme_minimal(base_size = 14) +
  labs(
    title = "Maths Scores by Race",
    subtitle = "Boxplot with overlaid points",
    x = NULL,
    y = "Maths Score"
  ) +
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1), legend.position = "none")














Density Plot: Science Scores

ggplot(exam_data, aes(x = SCIENCE)) +
  geom_density(fill = "orchid", alpha = 0.6) +
  theme_minimal(base_size = 14) +
  labs(title = "Science Score Density", x = "Science Score", y = "Density") +
  theme(panel.grid.minor = element_blank())
